borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div>The proposed rear extension by reason of scale, siting and design is considered harmful to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area. It is regarded an overdevelopment of the property. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies&nbsp;SP 2, DMD 1 and&nbsp;DMD 6&nbsp;of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19);</span></div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</div><div><br></div>

<div>The proposed rear extension by reason of scale, siting and design would result in an increased sense of overbearingness and a harmful loss of outlook to neighbouring occupiers, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;Policy DMD 1 and DMD 6 of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19);</span></div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</div>
